Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2008 06:01PM sbolonski30 wrote: Hi Susan I am 30yrs old and went for my 1st mamo 2 weeks ago, they found calcifications, sent me for a diagnotstix mamo which clarified a cluster of calcifications so this afternoon at 1:30 i had my stereotactic biopsy, from the time i layed on the table until i got up it was about 20 - 25 min. not so bad, for me i layed and they placed my small boob in a mamo device under me and it gently compressed, they took a few pictures then the doctor novacained, I never even felt that needle, i think i was to nervous and i just talked to the technician about her pretty hair, then he told me he was inserted the needle, turned on a vacuum machine that made a loud noise felt a tiny discomfort not pain just an odd feeling I guess your breast are sensitive and having object sin them isn't normal. I know before i went i came to this site and read and read and I found it extremely helpful so i am just trying to tell you as much as i can to help ease your mind. Tonite, my boob is a little soar but im making dinner, dancing around the house and cleaning, i will probably clean until friday when i get the results. My mom was diagnosed with breast cancer 2 yrs ago and to look at her now, no one would ever know she is more radiant and more beautiful then ever. I wish you luck. Stacy
Posts.Title: stereotactic breast biopsy susan1962 sbolonski30
